Articles.Content: A thread to discuss the possible end to Forums, why we are getting Bad Gateway blackouts and possible alternatives if the Forums were to close.

The bad gateways could be something with the URLs changing. It seems unlikely that the forums will close.  There are so many very active people keeping it alive, and I'm sure Intercept games will want to keep this for the future of KSP2. However, if the forums do close, we have to switch to... REDDIT

I would most likely cry should the forum ever fade away

I did a shallow dive into the phenomenom and I have a theory.

If as I understand it, the company that hosts the KSP servers is used by over 40% of the web sites world wide and if I am right from stuff I have read that Chat GPT has access to the server. It may be that Chat GPT is inadvertently causing the problems by accessing the servers , looking for data, at a rate far greater than humans alone would be doing. And these high speed and numerous calls to the servers are overwelming them. When they were first established they would not have been thinking of the servers being accessed as fast as these AI programs do.

Makes sense.

If you notice, each individual post has an identifying number, and each thread has a similar number.  It should be fairly “trivial” (says the person who barely understands the process) to create a bot who simply steps through the list of posts, and catalogs the text, poster, date, and the related Id numbers into a database.  It’s been done before with other forums.   The old posts/threads on the new forums would be archival only, since none of the user data would be collected, but you could still link to them and see the info.  
 

This is not to say the forums are going anywhere, we plan on being here a long time.   I’m just commenting on the feasibility of the project, as it’s been done before.
